intro: Dochafa flava, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white pubescence. The flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
